segments.text: I'm really starting to feel uncomfortable just looking at this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That overflowing sink, the water spreading everywhere, it's just so unsanitary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Who knows what's in that murky water collecting on the floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of walking in that puddle just makes my skin crawl.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the woman's foot is right there, submerged in it!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so calmly drying a plate that will eventually be eaten from.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids' cookie raid seems almost secondary to the growing swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then, the thought of them falling into that mess is equally repulsive.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Imagine the ruined cabinets, the damp, swelling wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a gross visual, the potential for mold and decay from all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels like a breeding ground for problems, literal and figurative.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost smell the stagnant water and the soggy wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I really wish someone would just turn off that faucet already.
segments.speaker: PAR
